messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Judgements~was Chng friends
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thank you so much.  I didn t mean to imply that I thought I was a failure, just that my parents and some of my siblings act dissappointed, as if I didn t
messages.messageBody:
>Nanci, it takes real courage to go against the norm and form your own
>path. With all due respect, YOU, are the successful one in your
>family! Where does failure even enter the picture? You have the
>strength to not fail your children!!!

Thank you so much. I didn't mean to imply that "I" thought I was a failure, just that my parents and some of my siblings act dissappointed, as if I didn't "live up to my potential." That kind of BS. I don't buy into it one bit, and I am happy and proud to have made the decisions that I did. I feel no quilt for not fulfilling my parents agenda. They had their lives, this one is mine.

Nanci K.
